website_summaries.verdict: Full of features that are designed for durability, such as an amphibious motor.
pros: A beast with a 9,500-pound capacity, which soars past its competition
The magnet in the control handle is a convenient detail
Includes the roller fairlead for reduced friction and a good-quality hook
cons: Some users have noted that the electrical cables are difficult to attach, and the mounting bracket may require modification for some situations

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this winch since February 2017, when it worked, it worked great. Too bad it's not waterproof like they claim. Put it under for about 2 minutes and it's dead. I should have went with Warn to begin with. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: 95XJ

customer_reviews.title: Smittybilt shipped this product to me and it didn't work ...
customer_reviews.text: Smittybilt shipped this product to me and it didn't work from the box. They refused to replace it. I found the problem (missing fuse) and fixed it at my cost. Then the remote plug and control box fell apart in my hands. I have contacted them again to give them a chance to back their (lifetime) guarantee. The had the nerve to tell me they are out of stock. And I need to contact them again in thirty days and send pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Thoughtful

customer_reviews.title: Looks great but DOA 2x, better to pass or buy a winch locally
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday gift for Son. He didn't use it until he needed it. It did not work when he needed it to, was sent a replacement, same DOA. DO NOT BUY, better off going to Harbor Freight at least then you can get a replacement same day. Looks great if you like spending $300 just for looks
customer_reviews.author: Peter Delfs

customer_reviews.title: I have a 1998 Jeep Wrangler. I used the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1998 Jeep Wrangler. I used the winch for the frist time today an it burnt up in 5 min. Junk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Snapped
customer_reviews.text: Mounting piece snapped when I used it for the first time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy. Go get a Warn
customer_reviews.text: Garbage winch. Finally got to install, drew cable in a half of a rotation then died. Now past 30 day return i have a pile of garbage. Spend the cash and get a warn.
customer_reviews.author: Washoe Walker

customer_reviews.title: BROKE IN UNDER 6 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in November 2017, it is now June 2018 (this has been on the trailer for less than 6 months, in an enclosed / watertight toolbox). Last month it stopped working while I was in the middle of winching a vehicle up. Went to use it today after replacing the fuse and double checking everything on it and it just keeps blowing fuses -- WILL NOT WORK. This thing is garbage if it only works a few times. I am going to contact Smittybilt to see what they are going to do..... so far NOT IMPRESSED.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap Chinese!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the winch and it arrived in days! I was very surprised that this shipped free as heavy as it was so kudos t0 Amazon. This is why I buy virtually everything from them. The install and wiring on my Go Rhino bumper was easy as can be. I have not yet used it off road and will provide a 6 month review after putting it through its paces. I will say that I researched so many winches and this seemed to be the very best deal I could find anywhere. The only negative is that this is made in China, so that probably is why its cheaper than Warn or other USA brands by lots.
customer_reviews.author: Overlander

customer_reviews.title: Lots Of Winch For The Money
customer_reviews.text: Truly the best winch for your money. Super easy install with clear directions, easy to operate and I love the low profile. The many mounting options for the solenoid really do help BUT, be careful of two things... 1. Make sure you completely wire up your solenoid to the motor before mounting to any plate or bumper or you will just have to take it off again to wire the ground connections 2. I was forced to mount it over the motor or the power leads would not reach to the battery posts in my 2010 JK Wrangler.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie S

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, It's Good.
customer_reviews.text: Great budget winch with excellent customer support to back it up. I have had this 12k winch for less than a year and used it many times. The toggle switch on the remote started acting crazy by spooling out line when I wasn't touching it. Called customer service and they shipped a new one without hesitation. Video is of the winch snapping a large limb from a tree. Gets me out of mud holes usually, but I use it for plenty of other things. Good tool to have.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: like it should
customer_reviews.text: After having it mounted for 3 years I finally used it to pull some stumps. It pulls hard, like it should, but not particularly fast, but fast enough for me. the clutch wouldn't let me spool the cable out manually, felt like it was released, but still too heavy / tight to pull 70 feet of cable out so we ran it out in reverse. One stump was stubborn, and started to pull my Ram 3500 w/ the Cummins Diesel (~7000 truck) over the concrete blocks in front of the tires, in park, with my son standing on the brakes. So it oughta get it out of a ditch if needed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: waste of $ and refused to give a refund/replacement. They’re cheap for a REASON
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it 0 stars I would! This thing is a piece of junk! Purchased it in March. Used it for the very first time (June) and it didn’t even work 😡😡😡😡 contacted them numerous times just to get the run around by 4wheeldrive hardware who “supposedly” handles smittybilt products on amazon. However BOTH smittybilt AND the other person, decided to give me a run around and REFUSED to either give me a warranty replacement or a refund, and played stupid. I’m sorry but I’m not dumb I can see right through your games.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: When I broke 2/5 of the pins that the remote plugged into, I contacted the seller and they were immediately replacing my broken product. The gentleman I worked with was very understanding and had no problem helping me. The winch is self is pretty good, I do wish I had bought one with a wireless remote, but this one works just fine. It's been used several times on the trails as well as to move broken down cars, and the winch has yet to let me down. I will definitely be sticking with my Smittybilt XRC winch until I cannot get replacement parts for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Kruschinska

customer_reviews.title: Installed in 2017 But did not used ounce till now!!  One Use Machine!
customer_reviews.text: I used this Winch to hold down two picnic tables I picked up in San Jose pulled the cable over the tables and winched it down. After I released tension and started to reeving in the cable it started to slow down then it stopped and never moved again. Up date 9/10/2020 found out why the winch was not working. The inside of the electric motor was half way full or water. After investigating the case and winding wear stained with rust. After drying the Winch works Fine, How long ?
customer_reviews.author: Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Not Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Stopped work after the 4 time using it. Not happy and don't know who to talk to about getting it fixed says it's under warranty
customer_reviews.author: chad Heater

customer_reviews.title: Works great, Smittybilt has excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd one. Already had one on another truck. It has been great. Used 3 - 5 times every hunting season. For commercial use, probably does not compare to a Warn but for my occasional use, its awesome for the price. This one arrived with a small defect in the remote but the guys at smittybilt answered the phone quick without long hold time. And shipped a replacement right away. Very pleased with product and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: What's your time worth?
customer_reviews.text: For all the time I've wasted, I could have bought a Warn. Incorrect instructions have you over-torque/break hardware. Support sent the wrong replacement component. Instructions clearly have never been proof-read by a native English speaker. (Seriously, Smittybilt: how much would that cost?) Solenoid will not install in 2 of the 3 configurations shown in the instructions (physically does not fit since the cables exit the solenoid in a different configuration/location than shown in the manual). Collectively, these things added up to hours lost and days of having my vehicle unavailable for what should have been an evening project. Fair or not, it doesn't give me much confidence in the longevity/reliability of this winch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother..
customer_reviews.text: I used this winch 4 times to pull tractors onto a tilt deck tralier with a block. It stopped working after that. I then bought a brand new deep cell battery and hooked it up directly. It just clicked and the power cables moved. Unless you're not going to use it for real, don't waste your money and get a Warn.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Syre

customer_reviews.title: Mounted with an Iron Cross bumper on a 2010 Dodge ...
customer_reviews.text: Mounted with an Iron Cross bumper on a 2010 Dodge Cummins 2500. IT DID NOT FIT! I had to get brackets welded on the bumper to make it work. I used the winch maybe 4 times and one of the 5 little prongs in the control box broke. I was always very careful plugging it in, no idea how it happened. 3 stars for now. We'll see how Smittybilt's customer service is and then change the rating accordingly. Update: Smittybilt swapped out the broken piece free of charge. Great company to work with!
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Buy a universal wireless remote, and toss the wired remote!
customer_reviews.text: Great winch for a good price. I have two 9500 lbs ones. One I’ve had on my gooseneck flatbed for about 5 years. One thing to do right away is get a universal wireless remote kit, I paid $17 on amazon for one. Two, throw away the wired remote, as the plug will get damaged straight away. Once you do that, you’ll have a great working winch!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The control box shown is not the one i received. Mine had the receptacle on the side. I ended up drilling a new hole on the top and relocating the plug. Siliconed in a aluminum patch. The bearing block is some strange size, the smitty built front licence plate holder does not fit and had to be modified. The holes in the bearing block did not line up with the holes in my bumper and the block is riding about 1/4 " low. Control box is low quality in both the mounting and feel and already have a small crack in the plastic by one of the mounting screws. Other than that functioned well and as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Milton S. Soditch

customer_reviews.title: I love this winch
customer_reviews.text: I love this winch!!! Very well made and would buy it over a Warn winch any day. I trust it and it has not let me down. Easy to install and it even looks great on the Jeep being low profile.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every Fathers Nightmare.  Daddy, you mean you bought a Smitty
customer_reviews.text: Got stuck with my little girl trying to get ice cream in the snow. I thought my new smitty would rescue us, but instead lost my superman persona that day. Thought I would break the news about Santa while a friend came over with a Warn. These things are gutless
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Bought it to put on a receiver hitch for my super duty. Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: Really a bang for you're buck on this. Bought it to put on a receiver hitch for my super duty. Works awesome. Got stuck acouple times this year in the snow and pulls good. No problems at all. Even can pull my truck sideways if I need to turn it around. Awesome winch
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bates

customer_reviews.title: Very good winch meets all my needs
customer_reviews.text: Very good winch meets all my needs. I use it to mainly pull logs out to cut up for my bbq smoker pulled out some large white oak & a large cherry didn't even slow it down. Very pleased would recommend to anybody looking for a good winch.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Baker

customer_reviews.title: grate, service bad
customer_reviews.text: rough county tops thy are junk do not fit right hard to put it ben on an off 5 times don,t go any eazyer zipper hard to move oil don,t help. toke 3 weeks to get here i live in Ga.it was shipped from N.C.so save time buy bestop the last on i had on was bestop but i saved $20.00 sorry no i have to buy a top an the nose can,nt here to radio junk junk junk junk junk that the rating 5 junks this is frist time i have gave a bad rating but it is what it is
customer_reviews.author: T.C.Coleman

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have only tested and exercised this winch. I feel sure it will do its job. I put it on a receiver tray and so do not leave it out in the weather. I did apply anti-oxidant paste to the pins and contacts. And I am careful when inserting the control into the winch. The remote control units may be a better alternative
customer_reviews.author: Jim White

customer_reviews.title: Needs some work.
customer_reviews.text: This winch is OK at best. The port where you connect the remote into cracked after one test run in the garage. It’s the weak point of the system, which then allows water inside the unit. The manual engage lever is almost impossible to use unless you keep playing with it to work it loose. It doesn’t fit on almost any closed winch bumper, it’s meant to sit on top of a open bumper. Not worth it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Trae

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best investment I've made for my Jeep JK
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best investment I've made for my Jeep JK. The winch was really easy to install and I love the fact that I can mount the control box in multiple ways. I chose flat on top and it looks great and doesn't impede the airflow to the engine. I've already used the winch twice pulling my 1950 Dodge truck up and down my driveway to move it. I highly recommend the synthetic rope for safety reasons. Well worth the money. Oh, and the winch is waterproof. Bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Ducky Brown

customer_reviews.title: It left me stranded.  YOU could be next.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a car trailer. I had to replace the wired remote after only 4-5 uses. After less than a year of use (20-25 pulls), it died. The motor burnt out and now is only fit for an anchor or yard art. It made it very difficult to load a vehicle. Something that should have taken 5 minutes of ease, turned out to be an hour plus of hard labor. I'm lucky I wasn't stuck in a remote area and needed to rely on it to get home. I'll buy a Warn next time.
customer_reviews.author: iHikeLV

customer_reviews.title: Read before buying!!
customer_reviews.text: Clutch has trouble going into free spool and engaged. I read on wrangler forums a lot of people have been having problems with this since 2010. Smittybilt, why have you not fixed this. This winch will work great. You just have to play around with it. It will get you unstuck and for the price you can’t beat it. However, if you want a more promising and easy winch I would go with warn. It is definitely worth it. This is a good winch when it wants to be. I just have to play around with it to get it to free spool.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Auto reversing ?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in April but just used it for the first time today. I believe the wired hand control is defective. When I engage the clutch and spool in it reverses as soon as I release the toggle? This makes it extreamly unsafe and down right unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Strong chain with a weak link.
customer_reviews.text: The only real issue I see, and it’s a potential issue, not real yet, are the very thin connector pins on the plug of the remote control. I’ve used the winch to rescue my 6,000 lb. tractor and it worked like a charm. But each time I’ve plugged in the remote, the pins hang up and threaten to bend. So far nothing has broken, but I see them as the weak link in an otherwise very strong chain.
customer_reviews.author: Generally Balanced POV

customer_reviews.title: They definitely need to revisit the remote plug in and design something more sturdy. It uses a pin style plug system and ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard to free spool out cable. Remote switch was faulty. Had to purchase a new remote but Amazon was quick to remedy this issue. Installation was fairly simple. If I had to purchase a winch again I would most likely spend the extra money and buy something a little nicer. Ok for the price I guess. They definitely need to revisit the remote plug in and design something more sturdy. It uses a pin style plug system and I am pretty sure I will end up breaking those pins off at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Harleylove79

customer_reviews.title: Quit working one month after installed
customer_reviews.text: Not a happy camper. The winch left me high and dry Owned this unit for one month, installed it did the recommended maintenance unit worked like a charm. Less than a month later I need this wench to pull my tj and the wench is deader then a door nail. Thanks smittybuilt
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this winch to mount onto my hunting jeep. Mountng was easy and the instructions were very clear. Hve had to use it a couple of times already when I got the jeep and 4 wheeler trailer stuck in deep mud holes while hunting. Winch pulled the jeep, trailer with 4 wheeler on it out of the mud holes with ease. Recommend this winch to anyone looking for a cost saving winch.
customer_reviews.author: Russell F

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Everything went together well! My disappointment is the disengage and freewheel sticker on the winch was all wrinkled and not on straight? I heated it up with my heat gun and pulled it off and reinstalled it, it looks better but some of it is still wrinkled, I have an X2O Smittybilt winch on my other Jeep, it’s didn’t have anything like that. I expect it to work great! My X2O pulled another Jeep out of the mud so I expect this one to do fine too!
customer_reviews.author: 107 HD

customer_reviews.title: No issues after one month
customer_reviews.text: This is a preliminary review after only one month of use. The unit works fine installed in a 2007 silverado classic with a rough country hidden winch mount. I have pulled with it twice and have had no issues. The complaints I do have are 1) the remote receiver has delicate prongs and a rubber cap that is easily dislodged. I would prefer if smittybilt put a more robust pin system in their remotes. 2) the clutch to freespool can be troublesome in moving from engaged to disengaged but nothing that can’t be overcome by simply winching in or out with the remote. Overall I am satisfied and will provide periodic updates as time and conditions warrant.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Defective item
customer_reviews.text: Beware - the Amazon vendor MotorGod has a very limited return window. After I had engaged a welding shop to fabricate a dedicated front-end mount and tried to use for the first time I learned that a faulty unit had been shipped to me (the cable would not unspool - upon examination, I discovered that one of the bolts on the clutch cover was cross-threaded). MotoGod responded by advising that I needed to contact manufacturer - Smittybuilt - who then informed me that I needed to refer the matter to the vendor. Both parties are now pointing their fingers at each other with me in the middle with an unusable winch.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L Riforgiat

customer_reviews.title: Junk, DO NOT BUY. Received wrong product and was broken
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Winch for a build and when I received the box I verified the part number matched was I ordered and was fine with that. BIG MISTAKE. Went to install for the build and found 4 problems: DID NOT HAVE SYNTHETIC WINCH LINE, DID NOT HAVE ALUMINUM FAIR LEAD, DID NOT HAVE HARDWARE, PLASTIC COVER WAS BROKEN. Looking at the previous reviews others are having problems too. I was at fault for not checking thoroughly when I received and it was outside of the return window. STAY AWAY and support the local 4WD shops instead.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product!
customer_reviews.text: Received the winch broken...motor fell off as I lifted it out of the box. Followed return process and received a shipping postage via email for UPS within minutes of submitting the claim. Repackaged and took the broken winch to UPS. They mailed back to Amazon and I received a full refund within a week. 4 stars for the refund process. I ended up getting another winch from 4WP. Installation was pretty simple.
customer_reviews.author: ItsJeepThing

customer_reviews.title: For my tractor
customer_reviews.text: I mounted a receiver hitch on the front bumper of my Kubota L4600 4wd tractor for this winch. I've used it twice to pull it out. I realize that the tractor weighs less than 4500 lbs but it easily pulls it out with it with it buried in muck.
customer_reviews.author: Chillin

customer_reviews.title: I bought / received this as a Christmas present after ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought / received this as a Christmas present after my neighbor purchased a Smitybilt winch. I was a little hesitant, as I had previously owned a Warn and had no problem with it. I've used it four times so far and it has worked perfectly so far. The most demanding winch was a half ton Chevy buried in the Gila River with water / mud over the rear tires. The winch performed perfectly with no issues what so ever. I am now looking at getting a 15,5 to mount on to a custom front bumper for my Superduty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great winch for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great winch for a great price. I put it through some hard use in the last year and it held up great, line speed is good and i will never use steel cable on a wheeling rig again. Only modification i did to it was running an in cab winch control which is a must for wheeling. Attached picture caved in my 3/16 boat sides and put a bow in the tub, front and rear axles were on rocks and the winch pulled me right out.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Broderick

customer_reviews.title: Winch came damaged
customer_reviews.text: The winch itself seems very solid and strong. But when I got it, there was some damages(see pics). Main one was to the control box cover where the controller plugs into the solenoid. Not a big deal, figure I can just get the replacement part. The issue is the customer service with 4WD.com. When I called them about this, I was put on hold for over an hour. And then when it comes to my turn, my call gets dropped. So I call back a different number and actually get a person to talk to. He seemed hurried and puts me back on hold with THE ORIGINAL number I had called! And so I'm on hold again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Packiging plus
customer_reviews.text: It came a week early. Everything was well packaged, box was a little beat up but that's to be expected with an 80 lbs package, and the winch and components were untouched. The instructions were super simple everything is clearly marked. Basic adjustable wrench was used there was no wire cap for the negative so I just wrapped it in electrical tape. But other than that everything looks amazing. Haven't mounted it yet because the bumper isn't finished yet. I will update when I get it mounted and operating
customer_reviews.author: justin n.

customer_reviews.title: I just love it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Installed after putting bumper on. Followed some videos on YouTube and used their recommendations for routing the wires to the battery. Took me longer than it should have because I was doing in at night and in the rain, but when it came I couldn't wait any longer. Followed instructions on first use and had no issues. My jeep (and a few others I have read) was missing a second bolt for the battery terming, so I connected to the main post. It kept loosening and killing the jeep so I found a bolt to connect to the extra terminal.
customer_reviews.author: Jay johnson

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken but was an easy fix.
customer_reviews.text: As others have reported, the plastic around the plug is brittle and breaks very easily. I just cut a small piece of aluminum and screwed the plug into it with some RTV in-between to make it water tight. It's very sturdy now. The remote cable is nice and long. This winch was a perfect fit behind the bumper in my 2006 Dodge Ram 1500. I've used it probably 30 times over the past year and never had any issues. It's paid for itself time and time again.
customer_reviews.author: JayDee240

customer_reviews.title: Check for cracked plastic parts.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a bumper and decided to get the winch. After connecting every thing,we went to connect the controller. It was broken at the point of connection don’t want to remove again. Brand new, I have fibromyalgia and can’t do it again. Diss appointed. It does work and will keep it
customer_reviews.author: Peter lopez

customer_reviews.title: It's larger in width than all of the lower models which fit a standard opening.
customer_reviews.text: The bolt pattern does match up to the standard 10x4 but it has additional mounting bolts which makes it larger thank the standard size. This means that carrier plates will not work and most bumpers that have pre-made mounting for a winch will also not work due to the large size. Do not use the recommended items. Please contact Smittybilt to find the dimensions. Std carrier plates have a ~7.5" opening while this winch needs at least 8.5"+. Not to mention the cable rollers are higher up than the others.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: tough
customer_reviews.text: it works, and works well. when every one else is running 6500lb and 9500 lb.. this thing pulls my pick up... lol. i use it wth a pully, and man, does this thing pull. but it is current hungry, so make sure u have a good alternator to recharge and good stout deep cycle battery to hold up against the use.
customer_reviews.author: Ashmeed Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Let down
customer_reviews.text: Looks great doesn’t it? That’s about all it’s worth I used this winch once and it worked great. I was hung up and needed it to get me out of a hole. Let me down. Should’ve spent the extra money on a Warn. I’ve made several attempts at getting a replacement or refund. No replies. Stay away from this one. Will update if customer service makes any sort of effort.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!
customer_reviews.text: I think it is a descent product for the price. However, if you have an issue and need help from seller, GOOD LUCK! The winch arrived with a broken piece. It doesn’t affect the operation. But it is broken and it shows at first glance. I emailed the seller twice and allowed five days the first time for a response, allowed 2 days the second time I emailed them. I got zero response from them. Finally I decided to install the winch and forget the problem. I will NOT buy from Smittybilt again.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Z

customer_reviews.title: Was impressed at first
customer_reviews.text: Have had my winch for three years and I have only used it maybe 5 times. Worked very well until about two months ago while rolling it back in (not winched to anything) it just died. So now the cable is wrapped around my bumper to keep it from dragging the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn brewer

customer_reviews.title: Quality is great. Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Besides it being heavy to install by myself. I did it and works great. Fit was perfect too. Looks awesome. Great winch for the money. Also had wonderful instructions that made install easy. Did have damage to packaging but everything worked fine. Heavy for delivery person I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Joey T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome winch for the money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I use mine on a portable mount to move between different vehicles/tractors/trailers. My only complaint is I underestimated the weight. If it is permanently installed who cares but if you have it on a hitch mount like I do be prepared that this thing is built like a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor J. Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Great value and nice for unconventional builds
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a good value winch. A lot of Warn is made over seas now so this is a good option. I like how you can mount the electrical box in multiple locations and in my case I needed a custom location. The electrical box came with L brackets that I used to attach to my winch mount and screws. See pic. I haven’t had the need to use it off rd but will update when that happens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with your product
customer_reviews.text: I have held off writing a review for one year, so I wouldn’t be bias. I have had to use this winch twice in 12 months .. it worked once! Of course it didn’t work when I needed it the most! I have called the help line to get some help in repairing it or warranty work. I stayed on hold for a total af 1 hour and still have had no one willing to assist. I have been transferred from dept. to dept. If by chance someone at smittybuilt sees this and wants to help me .. please by all means contact me here. Not happy with your product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received broken
customer_reviews.text: I have contacted Smittybilt and will change my review if/when I hear back from them. We ordered this at the end of May. It’s been sitting in the box waiting for a good time we were off and it wasn’t 100+ outside. Any how finally was able to get installed today and didn’t notice when we put it on but it came to us broken. Yes I know I should have looked at it before we put it on... but I was excited to finally put it on. Can’t return it because we are outside our amazon return window.
customer_reviews.author: amanda wilson

customer_reviews.title: Bocken and doesnt work!
customer_reviews.text: The product does not work out of the box and the plug for the remote is broken. This is the worse. Spent hours setting up and installing and it doesnt work. Now i have to take it all apart again and try to get all the parts together to ship this heavy box. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: cheapest name-brand 9500# winch
customer_reviews.text: very well pkgd and instructions are great. installing it, wiring it up was all a breeze. tested and worked like it should. only thing i dislike is the remotes connector plug. SMITTYBUILT could have done a better job with those small needle-like pins in the plug. hopefully none break or bend ever!
customer_reviews.author: alexander rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Huge winch, check size before buying
customer_reviews.text: This winch is huge. Check the dimensions of the winch before you buy. It's bolt pattern my work but still not fit your mount. It doesn't fit a westin Max winch tray without modification. Winch appears to pretty heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: brenton Pomeroy

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: It arrived broken and I called their customer service number but no one answered during normal business hours and leaving a message was not an option. Their call for assistance card enclosed makes me smile (pictured)...sounds like a good idea but if no one answers then what is the point? The solenoid cover is plastic and where the controller plugs in could not possibly be constructed in a less durable manner. Very disappointed do yourself a favor and buy from someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Good quality winch for the price. Everything worked first time - instructions were very easy to follow. Everything you need to install is provided. Damn thing is heavy, so you may need some help to lift. I installed with a new bumper by mounting the winch before putting everything on the car.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Works great I converted mine to wireless by purchasing a Mile Marker universal wireless winch adapter. Ahhh no cables! Its a great winch. If I used it eery single day I might buy a more expensive one but... It works well when it needs too and that is maybe once or twice a year. 1 year no rust or anything!
customer_reviews.author: PENGUINTOE

customer_reviews.title: bought a second for my trailer.
customer_reviews.text: Had this winch on the front of my jeep for probably 4 years now. Never once had a cover. Out in PA rain and snow. Works perfectly every time never had a single problem with it. Overloaded it quite a few times at work too. So happy with this winch i bought another one for my equipment trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: So far the winch has been great. It pulled my 18,000lb dead weight forklift up onto my trailer. The winch slowed briefly when the forklift rolled up to the ramps, and broke the crest onto the trailer. The controller cable could be longer for my purposes. But for the price, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps over rated.  More like 4-5k force
customer_reviews.text: So, I hooked this up to two snatch blocks, supposedly giving me 27k of pulling force. I wanted it to pull 1.5 cord of wood, it failed. I hooked up a third snatch block (36k of force), it started, and struggled but moved it. I'd say the wood, with friction considered, would weigh around 4-6k lbs. Why I needed 36k of force to move it? Perhaps this winch is over rated.
customer_reviews.author: Just a white guy

customer_reviews.title: Great winch for price
customer_reviews.text: Installed this Smittybilt winch along with new front and rear bumpers on my '17 Jeep Wrangler Unlimited. Really happy with the winch, its function, and design. Install instructions were a bit vague, but got it figured out after a little youtube searching. Great winch for the price
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This winch is awesome we have them on all our company's trucks and ...
customer_reviews.text: This winch is awesome we have them on all our company's trucks and use them every week! Always pulls the trucks out but also our heavy equipment. Not many can say their winch can recover a 15000lb peice of heavy equipment thats buried in mud! **Safety note if you plan to winch heavy also buy the 36000lb smittybuilt snach block**
customer_reviews.author: Justin V.

customer_reviews.title: Hire someone to install it!
customer_reviews.text: The winch responded just like it's supposed to. The first one we got was damaged, contacted Smittybuilt and sent them pictures. Had the replacement parts inside of a week. Installing it to a Smittybilt snubby bumper with tubular grill guard was a challenge. Small fingers or magnetized tools are a must! The directions weren't the easiest, thank goodness for youtube. Once installed, it works like a dream. Makes going mudding just a little bit more daring knowing that I can usually get myself out of sticky situations.
customer_reviews.author: ncdolphinsamm

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for all the features!
customer_reviews.text: Winch off to a good start, working well w/ perfect capacity for our 2dr Wrangler. Good fit & finish and easy to install. I prefer the control box over the motor to keep the air through the grill unblocked and this has that mounting option. Good warranty too!
customer_reviews.author: blnewt

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but it’s cheap as hell. I’ve had to fix the clutch on it (wouldn’t free spool) and now the outlet the remote plugs into has broken off so it’s no longer water proof.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Smittybilt 9500 lb winch
customer_reviews.text: I had this installed professionally when I had my front bumper installed..I've yet to use it but it appears to be very straightforward in operation and maintenance..Another product from Smittybilt that I've purchased and have no issues what so ever
customer_reviews.author: bluegrasspioneer fan

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2003 GMC Sierra 2500HD. I thought it would be enough, but I later read that the winch should be 1.5 times the weight of the vehicle. I decided I'd buy a stronger cable before I used the winch. Well, as plans go, I got stuck before I bought a cable, and I was pulling a trailer. This winch pulled us out without any struggle. I even did it a second time just to be sure. I would recommend Smittybilt winches.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Milnes

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality connections
customer_reviews.text: Beyond cheap plug connection from remote cable to control unit. The first time I tested the unit after installing, the connection point on the control unit broke apart when I unplugged the remote cable. The cheap plastic design will absolutely fail at some point, for me it lasted less than a minute and this happened in the garage, not even on the trail. I'm baffled that Smittybilt would put their name on a product so poorly designed that could someday be required to save your life. The actual winch seems to be solid but when, not if the control unit breaks it quickly becomes a 50 lb. anchor on your front bumper.
customer_reviews.author: Chad scott

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but have some patience with the install
customer_reviews.text: A bit of difficulty on the installation, a bit of confusion with my particular bumper/winch combination. But overall not too bad. The control box that came with the winch had a bad cover, it was cracked right where the handheld control plugs in at. I called costumer service and they are sending me a new cover. No hassle!
customer_reviews.author: lyle

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic controller came in real handle and happy it had it
customer_reviews.text: 3 years of owner ship. In uncovered conditions. Got my jeep out of a big I should not have went in. Got a lot of other people unstuck as well. Was a lifetime saver. Magnetic controller came in real handle and happy it had it.
customer_reviews.author: Caveman775

customer_reviews.title: Its good so far Only issues is the remote control plug ...
customer_reviews.text: Its good so far Only issues is the remote control plug outlet.. They over tighten the screws, which caused it to crack and break so my husband ended up having to glue the piece on !!! Update so hubby had the winch for about 3 years now well the motor went out, to qhere he was stuck..good thing he was riding with other jeepers, smittybilt sent us a new one which worked great the first time. Now hubby is having the same issue where the motor is dead. You can hear it clicking but the motor is not pulling the line in or letting line out....
customer_reviews.author: Micha K

customer_reviews.title: Great winch, have had no problems
customer_reviews.text: Have used it a couple times and have had no issues. Very powerful and extremely useful. Great winch for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Desrosiers

customer_reviews.title: Best you will find for under $300
customer_reviews.text: No it's not a warn, but it's way better quality than any other $300 winch. I bought the Smitty built raised winch plate with it. Made installing it in my wrangler smooth. Install time was three hours working alone. Don't compare it to a thousand dollar winch. But if you want the best if the cheap then this is it. Shipping was fast, almost overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Guntana

customer_reviews.title: Good winch for good value, a tad tricky to mount
customer_reviews.text: Great winch at a bargain. Hooked it up pretty easily. The only problem I had was with the mounting. There are 4 bolts for mounting, and 4 square nuts. The nuts go inside the feet of the winch (A bit hard to get them in there) THEN the bolts have something to grab onto. Took me a bit to figure it out but got it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: but not as bad as other Smittybilt products (bumpers)
customer_reviews.text: I did just install this yesterday so take that for what it's worth. The instructions are a little misleading, but not as bad as other Smittybilt products (bumpers). I purchased this "Used, but in Very Good Condition", which actually meant "New, but the box is slightly damaged". Overall, I'm very please with it so far... again I haven't used it yet. Installation was tricky as I had to take my XRC bumper back off to do the install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No. Not this one.
customer_reviews.text: Used it once. Completely dead now. Electrical issue? No idea. Had it professionally installed. Now it's a very expensive paperweight, after paying for the cradle, bumper work to get it to fit, etc. I was warned (lol no pun intended) about this brand and should have listened.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Great Winch. Solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Great Winch. Solid construction. One thing though keeping it from 5 stars. Would it be too much to include some heavy duty galvanized washers for the attachment to the bumper? I realize all bumpers are different but I cannot imagine an application where the bolts only are what you want holding winch to the bumper if you are going to pull 9000 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Starr

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I got to try this winch for the first time yesterday and it pulled my snow plow truck out of a five foot sloped down hill snow bank that I was buried in. It pulled the plow truck out with plenty of power to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Al Grant

customer_reviews.title: Nice winch!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm well pleased. I haven't used it yet to pull anything heavy or any vehicles but I am sure it will do the job. My last winch was a different brand, 8,000 lb. and I put it through a lot of abuse before it gave out after several years so if this one does as well it will be a winner. Fit and function are good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great winch for the price, I had one on my JK as well and never failed me. Winch maintenance is a must and easy. I just stretch the cable out and spray wd40 as I roll it back up. The winch came packaged well and I've used it twice, once to test and once to pull a vehicle. instructi ok NSA were to the point probably took 35 min to install everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Great product, only down fall was there is no Neoprene Cover that should come with it. Can not even purchase a Neoprene cover for it. The Smittybilt winch covers that are available are not the best. this is why I rated this item 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Drew

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this wench
customer_reviews.text: I love this wench and it works great. Be careful where you run the wires. The first time I had this, right after the install my battery cables got caught in the cooling fan on the engine. (Not good) Then had to splice a new piece together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t pass up a great deal. Installed on 2000 Jeep Wrangler
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation. You need a plate to install on stock bumper. Wiring was easy to route to battery with plenty of wires. Remote has a very long cable. Works but have not used it to pull anyone out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Marquezj16

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! The cast aluminum house omg was cracked so the bolts would not thread. One day outside the return window for amazon, of course. Completely unusable. Don’t waste your hundreds of dollars or time.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Steffen

customer_reviews.title: I custom mounted the control box so it is easily accessible through the access hole
customer_reviews.text: Used it a few times now, installed in my Demello bumper on my FJ Cruiser. Decent line speed, enough power, and being able to clock the motor to position the clutch handle where I needed it was crucial to my install. I custom mounted the control box so it is easily accessible through the access hole. About the best bang for the buck out there if you are using your winch occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: PDXsasquatch

customer_reviews.title: can't beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.text: works flawlessly everytime! the versatile mounting was perfect for my low profile mounting needs. pulls my scout with ease. the remote connector does look a little light duty but I just make sure to plug it in carefully and have had no problems yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F.

customer_reviews.title: Great winch
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this size winch with synthetic rope. I have owned many Warn winches and have not seen any difference in features or durability with the Smittybilt. I have it mounted on a one ton GMC crew cab and it has pulled me out twice. I would not hesitate to purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: tctopcat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use
customer_reviews.text: This works great for pulling my cars up into my covered car 30' trailer. And it mounted perfectly with this bracket that I highly recommend = RUGCEL WINCH 23" Cradle Winch Mounting Plate, Winch Mount Recovery Winches. The mounting bolts lined up perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Jason R Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Installation is easy. I would suggest a better method of attaching the control box to the winch. The current design is in my opinion not the best. Works as expected. Long term durability is TBD.
customer_reviews.author: Steve in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Proceed with caution!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap cheap cheap. Controller is made of fragile plastic. Ordered and returned. The same winch at 4wheelparts had damage to same areas. Supplier was good and gave me a full refund a week later. Really disappointing when you are ready to install and the winch is broken.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Worked while under water!
customer_reviews.text: Used this winch while it was under water to pull my jeep out and up a very steep hill. After I got back home I used an electrical contact cleaner to clean the plug for the remote and have no problems with it. I would highly recommend this winch.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Great winch for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Don't be surprised like I was at how hard it is to pull the rope out on free spool when you first get it. The instructions say it would be tight but it was VERY tight.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolle

product_meta.title: Smittybilt GEN 2 XRC Winch | 9,500 Pound Load Capacity
product_meta.description: Size:9500 lb. Load Capacity| Style:SingleThe Gen2 series of Smittybilt XRC winches have been thoroughly updated with heavy-duty features for enhanced performance and durability. Ranging from 9, 500–17, 500 pound, the XRC GEN2 winch is a complete recovery system with the muscle and reliability to bail you out of any situation. All Gen2 XRC Winches come backed by a Lifetime Mechanical and a 5-Year Electrical .
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One Smittybilt GEN2 XRC Winch, 97495 model with 9,500 lbs. load capacity

Winch dimensions: 22.3” L x 5.4” W x 9.4” H | Product Weight: 78 lbs. | Weight capacity: 9,500 lbs. | Cable type – 93.5” diameter, Wire rope | Motor – 6.6hp | Control – 12” lead | Gear-train – 3-stage planetary | Fairlead – 4-way roller
Kit comes complete with all wiring required for installation. Smittybilt recommends using supplied wiring

Smittybilt offers a limited lifetime for replacement to the original purchaser on stainless steel products. Dual-stage, powder coated products carry a 5-year or 100,000 mile warrany, whichever comes first

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,664 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
